item.title: Open Offices Covid Casualty
item.description: Coronavirus could wipe out the open office floor plan as quickly and decisively as it wiped out many corporate bottom lines. Companies that move to an open office cite two benefits for the design: Cost savings by cramming more people into a given amount of space. Increased innovation, driven by collaboration. But multiple studies show that both assumptions are wrong. Now, Coronavirus has proven that open offices represent a significant public health threat, as well.
